text.section:
If a licensee fails for any reason to renew a license by the end of the 30-day grace period, the Board shall reinstate the license if the licensee:
Applies to the Board for reinstatement of the license within 5 years after the license expires;
Meets the renewal requirements of § 2-308 of this subtitle; and
Pays to the Board the renewal fee and the reinstatement fee set by the Board.

The Board may not reinstate the license of an audiologist, hearing aid dispenser, speech-language pathologist, or speech-language pathology assistant who fails to apply for reinstatement of the license within 5 years after the license expires, unless the audiologist, hearing aid dispenser, speech-language pathologist, or speech-language pathology assistant:
Meets the requirements of § 2-305 of this subtitle; or
Meets the current requirements for obtaining a new license under this title including continuing education requirements established by the rules and regulations of the Board.
